post.description: Steel column that is subjected to axial force, biaxial bending moment and shear force and steel beam that is subjected to the bending moment are designed. Automatic design or code check for load resistance capacity of cross-sections like H-beam depending on the form of member is conducted.

code.title: Code
code.description: Unique code for the material as defined in the material database. This is used to identify the specific steel material.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the steel material. The material name is selected from a list of available materials.

matl.title: Material
matl.description: A steel material used in structural design, with customizable options for material code and name. The material properties are selected from a predefined list.

shape.title: Section Shape
shape.description: Structural steel section profile type (e.g., H-shape, T-shape, Channel, Angle). This parameter defines the fundamental cross-sectional geometry of the steel member.

name.title: Section Name
name.description: Standardized designation of the steel section based on industry specifications. This identifier corresponds to specific dimensional and structural properties in the steel section database.

sect.title: Section
sect.description: Database specifications for structural steel sections including section shape and standardized member designations. This configuration provides essential cross-sectional properties for structural steel design and analysis.

axial.title: Axial
axial.description: Axial force acting along the longitudinal axis of the member. Positive values indicate compression, negative values indicate tension.

bending.title: Moment
bending.description: Bending moment acting about the member's major axis (X-axis). This represents the primary flexural action in the strong axis direction.

shear.title: Shear
shear.description: Shear force acting parallel to the member's major axis (X-axis). This represents the transverse force causing horizontal shear deformation.

axial.title: Axial
axial.description: Axial force acting along the longitudinal axis of the member. Positive values indicate compression, negative values indicate tension.

bending.title: Moment
bending.description: Bending moment acting about the member's major axis (X-axis). This represents the primary flexural action in the strong axis direction.

shear.title: Shear
shear.description: Shear force acting parallel to the member's major axis (X-axis). This represents the transverse force causing horizontal shear deformation.

load.title: Force
load.description: The plus sign in axial is compression.

length.title: Member Length
length.description: Buckling length is the length at which a structural member, such as a column or plate, can resist the phenomenon of buckling. Buckling is the sudden deformation of a long member under compressive load along its own center of gravity, which has a significant impact on the safety of a structure. Buckling length is an important factor in analyzing and preventing this phenomenon.

effLen.title: Column Design Option
effLen.description: Effective length factor for column design.

c1.title: C1
c1.description: ratio between the critical bending moment and the critical constant bending moment for a member with hinged supports

cMlt.title: Cmlt
cMlt.description: equivalent uniform moment factor for LTB

factor.title: Moment Modification Factor
factor.description: Moment modification factor for beam design.

type.title: Method Type
type.description: These calculation methods are used to verify the global stability of a member under complex loading (compression and bending). These factors are included in the verification formulas (6.61 and 6.62) given in section 6.3.3.(4) of the EN 1993-1-3:2005 code.

opt.title: Design Parameter
opt.description: Design parameters for beam design, including effective length factor, moment modification factor, and interaction factor.

result.title: Result
result.description: have to base64 to binary data

x-content-info.title: Eurocode 3 Beam Design

Automatic design or code check for load resistance capacity of cross-sections like H-beam depending on the form of member is conducted.

length.title: Member Length
length.description: Buckling length is the length at which a structural member, such as a column or plate, can resist the phenomenon of buckling. Buckling is the sudden deformation of a long member under compressive load along its own center of gravity, which has a significant impact on the safety of a structure. Buckling length is an important factor in analyzing and preventing this phenomenon.

type.title: Method Type
type.description: These calculation methods are used to verify the global stability of a member under complex loading (compression and bending). These factors are included in the verification formulas (6.61 and 6.62) given in section 6.3.3.(4) of the EN 1993-1-3:2005 code.

DesignParameter.title: Design Parameter
DesignParameter.description: Design parameters for beam design, including effective length factor, moment modification factor, and interaction factor.

EffectiveLengthFactor.title: Effective Length Factor
EffectiveLengthFactor.description: The Effective Length Factor is an important parameter used to evaluate the ability of a column or member in a structure to resist buckling. This factor adjusts the actual length of the member to help analyze buckling based on the anchorage conditions of the column. The effective buckling length factor defines the relationship between the buckling length and the column's anchorage conditions.

type.title: Method Type
type.description: These calculation methods are used to verify the global stability of a member under complex loading (compression and bending). These factors are included in the verification formulas (6.61 and 6.62) given in section 6.3.3.(4) of the EN 1993-1-3:2005 code.

InteractionFactorAnnex.title: Methods of Calculation of Interaction Factors kij
InteractionFactorAnnex.description: Contains the list of calculation methods of the interaction factors kij

SteelMomentModificationFactor_EC.title: Steel Moment Modification Factor
SteelMomentModificationFactor_EC.description: A coefficient used in structural design to adjust the moments in a structure based on specific conditions or types of support. It is often applied to improve the assessment of loads and moments on columns, beams, or other structural elements. moment modification factor plays an important role in adjusting the moments to reflect the behavior and loading conditions of the structure.
